For information on our full range of classes, sign up to the Guardian Masterclasses newsletter, follow us on Twitter, or keep an eye on our calendar Learn how to stay ahead of the curve and achieve your business goals at this one-hour Masterclass with marketing expert Amy Hobson. During the class, you’ll receive an introduction to the digital landscape, as well as tips on strategy, branding and content measurement.     Pure London Photograph: http://www.purelondon.com/    The class also includes advice on key tools, such as Google Shopping and email marketing platforms. Altogether, it’s the ideal crash course for business professionals and entrepreneurs who want to ensure the right people hear about their products.  Tutor profile Amy Hobson is a social media trainer and partner at SocialB. During her career, she’s worked extensively within the retail and franchising sector for both national and international brands. Amy is passionate about sharing her knowledge to assist growth and development within the retail industry. About Pure London Please note: Pure London is a trade-only event for anyone in the business of fashion and is not open to the public. Please ensure that you work in any element of fashion before booking your ticket. To attend this class, you must also have a ticket for Pure London. Tickets are free of charge, visit Pure London’s website to register your details and secure your place. Pure London is the UK’s leading trade fashion buying event, representing womenswear, menswear, footwear, accessories and young fashion. Organised by i2i Events Group, it takes place every February and July. The show offers buyers the opportunity to discover collections launching for the season ahead from over 800 brands, with opportunities to attend catwalk shows and hear from peers and industry experts during valuable seminars and workshops. Pure London is open to anyone in the fashion industry, including people working in UK and international independents, department stores, retailers, mail order companies and more.
